title: Police on hunt for fugitive dad that shook baby so hard he caused catastrophic brain injury
text:
Police on hunt for fugitive dad that shook baby so hard he caused catastrophic brain injury Violent Zsolt Lakatos was handed a 13-year jail sentence in his absence after absconding from his trial and going on the run   Share   Comments By JENNY KIRKHAM 09:14, 7 FEB 2017 Updated 09:27, 7 FEB 2017 News Lakatos, 31, from Ashdale Road, Walton , had admitted causing the child grievous bodily harm (Photo: Mersyside Police)   Share   Comments Get daily   Police have launched a search for a fugitive dad who shook his baby so hard it caused catastrophic brain injuries.
Violent Zsolt Lakatos was handed a 13-year jail sentence in his absence after absconding from his trial at Liverpool crown court . 
Lakatos, 31, from Ashdale Road, Walton , had admitted causing the child grievous bodily harm but denied a charge of inflicting GBH with intent. 
He gave evidence to the court last week but failed to turn up on Monday.
The judge continued without him and the jury found him guilty.
A warrant was issued for his arrest, reported the Liverpool Echo . 
Read More Mum shares heartbreaking experience of ectopic pregnancy in desperate warning to other mothers Zsolt Lakatos, also known as George Lakatos, 31, leaving Liverpool Crown court, during his trial for allegedly shaking a baby and leaving the child with severe injuries. Lakatos denies two counts of causing grievous bodily harm with intent (Photo: Daily Mirror) Merseyside Police are now appealing for information in regards to Lakatos’s whereabouts and are urging the public to help them with their search.
A spokesperson for the force said: “Lakatos is described as white, 5ft 8in tall, with black hair, of heavy build, with a dark complexion.
Read More Boy, five, died in agony 'after medics missed crippling condition for two years and sent him home with Calpol' “ Merseyside Police is urging anyone with information on the current whereabouts of Lakatos to call 101, quoting crime reference 0515169081, or you can call Crimestoppers, anonymously and for free, on 0800 555 111.” 
Zsolt Lakatos, also known as George Lakatos, 31, leaving Liverpool Crown court, during his trial for allegedly shaking a baby and leaving the child with severe injuries. Lakatos denies two counts of causing grievous bodily harm with intent (Photo: Daily Mirror) The child, who is now 22 months old and in foster care, has significant visual impairment and can only roll over with help.
The court heard he has some understanding of language and enjoys music but his life expectancy has been reduced.
